meanings.definition: To give strength or courage to
meanings.sent1: Seeing his friends cheer him on heartens him to keep going.
meanings.sent2: The kind words from his teacher hearten him before the big test.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics hearten everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise over the mountains heartens the soul with its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The supportive crowd's applause heartens the performer on stage.

meanings.definition: To make more cheerful or hopeful
meanings.sent1: The surprise visit from her best friend heartens her on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project heartens the team for future endeavors.
meanings.sent3: The colorful balloons hearten the atmosphere at the party.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected good news heartens the entire community.
meanings.sent5: The blooming flowers hearten the garden with their vibrant colors.
